intro: Wigandia kunthii f. africana, commonly known as African velvetleaf, is a tropical herbaceous plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils near human settlements. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
